fields.description:
h3. Summary

When anonymous access is enabled, an error is shown instead of the login page, when anonymous try to access a blog post without anonymous permissions.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Mobile browser (any)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable global anonymous access;
 # Restrict anonymous access from a space;
 # Try to open a blog post from that space without being logged (anonymous).

h3. Expected Results

The login page should be shown
h3. Actual Results

The error page below is shown:
|!Screen Shot 2018-02-23 at 14.40.41.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Workaround
 # Open the menu and then Login;
 # After logging in, access the dashboard and find the page.
fields.summary: Login screen not shown in mobile when anonymous access is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who have Archived Old Spaces have noticed that when they look in their Space Categories, these Archived Spaces appear. 

This is by design as an [Archived Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=724764817]:
{quote}Won't appear in the general spaces lists in the *Space Directory*, but will instead appear under the *Archived Spaces* list. It will, however, still appear under any categories it was labeled with.{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
In order to help reduce clutter when navigating through Space Categories, Hide Archived Spaces from Categories

h3. Workaround 
Remove the category labels from Archived Spaces
fields.summary: Hide Archived Spaces from Space Categories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Versions of attachments with umlauts in title are uploaded as separate files if uploaded from different os-es between versions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file with an umlaut in the title on a Windows machine. 
# Upload file as attachment to Confluence
# Create a file with the same title on a Mac OS Machine
# Upload file as attachment to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
The two files should be a single attachment with two versions

h3. Actual Results
Two distinct attachments appear
 
h3.Workaround
Avoid usage of characters such as umlauts in the title
fields.summary: Versions of attachments with umlauts in title are uploaded as separate files if uploaded from different os-es between versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Confluence Cloud if you create a page, add a title and then close it, a draft will be saved, but if you go to a space and click Blog>Create blog post and close that blog after adding some content, there will be no draft.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a space
# Click Blog in the sidebar
# Click Create Blog Post
# Add a title and a line of content
# Click the Close button
# No draft will appear under My Work and if you go back to the space and click Blog in the sidebar, there is no blog for the space.

h3. Expected Results
A draft of the blog would appear under My Work for the user who created the blog

h3.Workaround
# Create the blog on another page and copy/paste it over to the Blog for the space
# Publish the blog instead of closing without publishing

h3.Note:
 Confluence server 6.7 does save the blog draft when the Close button is used.
fields.summary: Blog drafts are not saved when Close button used before publishing

fields.description: The vertical space between several sections (when using 'single column' format) is not large enough leading to suboptimal user experience. I would increase that space to have neater layout.
fields.summary: Improve space between single column sections

Is there any way I can do that?

Is there any free plugin which I can use?
fields.summary: Holiday Tacker in Confluence

fields.description: Allowing users to change the background colors from the Jira Issue/Filter Macro columns and filed would help users to have a better view of the issues situation, collaborate on issue prioritization and help to further organize the information.
fields.summary: Ability to change the background color in the Jira Issue/Filter Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inline comments with emojis included display anchor like behavior
h3. Environment
 *  Cloud Confluence
 * Using inline comments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate through a page with inline comments using arrows up and down 

h3. Expected Results
 # Normal navigation occurs, seamlessly, whether navigating up or down

h3. Actual Results
 # When hitting a particular comment you get kicked to the top of the page

h3. How to spot the problem
 * Right click the suspect comment's highlighted text
 * Close inspection might reveal that text and an emoji is highlighted
 * The emoji inserts an additional tag; which behaves similarly to an anchor
 * Right clicking the highlighted text and inspect the elements,  then edit the tag as HTML
 * Removing the extra tag will stop the issue, however it won't update the Storage format and will appear after loading again.

h3. Potential Workaround(theoretical)
 * Have the user who created the inline comment edit it, remove the emoji, separating it from the highlighted text. Or deleting the emoji and then try to add it again. This may remove it from the storage format as desired in order to keep the tag out when loading the comment.
fields.summary: Inline Comment Navigation Jumps with highlighted emoji

fields.description:
In the Cloud platform, when working with the installation of specific add-ons (e.g. Gliffy, Trello), the same will add a new user to the application, that will be responsible for managing and having the add-on's functions properly working with the application.

However, as the same will be an active system user, it will be displayed in the *People Directory*:

!people.png|thumbnail!

As these users are not contributors/members of the site, this is a suggestion to have only users added/created by the administrator/application displaying in the People Directory. Specifically, only Active users (not including the *system* users)
fields.summary: Confluence People Directory Should Not Display Add-on Users

fields.description:
Currently it seems that if you export/import a space and do not re-index Confluence will trigger a sync on the user directory. This might be fine for small directories but in instances where there are thousands of users and groups the sync is very time consuming.

 

On the other hand if you decide to re-index after importing a space that process also takes as long if you have huge amounts of objects.

 

This is an issue when you are migrating several spaces and would like to perform the re-indexing once you have moved all the spaces and not have to trigger either a re-index or LDAP sync in between each import as it can literally take days to move just a dozen or so spaces.

 

Can an option be added to either import multiple backups at the same time or disable the LDAP sync after a new space is imported or the Build Index checkbox is not selected?
fields.summary: Confluence should not trigger LDAP sync after space import

fields.description:
Page tree in the sidebar does not show the page you are if there's a page above the Space's homepage

h3. Summary

Once you navigate to a page that's part of the Page's hierarchy within a space, the Page Tree will display the whole path above the page you're in.

For example:

{code}
Space's Homepage
	Page A
	Page B
		Page B-1
		Page B-2
			Page B-2-1
		Page B-3
	Page C
	Page D
{code}

If you reach the {{B-2-1}} page, the Space's sidebar will be displayed as it is above.

However, if you set up your space like this:
{code}
Page A
	Space's Homepage
		Page B
			Page B-1
			Page B-2
				Page B-2-1
			Page B-3
		Page C
		Page D
{code}

And you try to access the {{B-2-1}} page, the sidebar's page tree will load like this:

{code}
		Page B
		Page C
		Page D
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Space
# Create some pages
# Go to *Space Tools* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder pages*
# Order pages in a way that the *Space's Homepage* is placed as a child page
# Go to any page inside the space's hierarchy

h3. Expected Behavior

The sidebar would display as usual.

h3. Actual Behavior

The sidebar only displays the pages that are immediately under the Space's Homepage. It should display the whole path to the page you're currently in.

h3. Workaround

# Go to *Space Tools* > *Content Tools* > *Reorder Pages*
# Reorganize your pages in a way that no page is above the Space's homepage
fields.summary: Page tree in the sidebar does not show the page you are if there's a page above the Space's homepage
Show user-friendly message when user blocks third-party cookies

fields.description:
h3. Summary
"Broken Image" error is displayed for images from a restricted page (user has access to the page) on both mobile apps. 

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Mobile app (android AND IOS)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert images on a page and restrict this page;
# Create another page and attach the images from the first page (from the Insert files and Images dialog);
# Publish the page;
# Open it on the mobile app.

h3. Expected Results
The images would display for the user who created the pages.

h3. Actual Results
An error is shown instead of the image:
 !broken_image.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Re-upload the images on the second page.
fields.summary: "Broken image" shown for images on the mobile apps

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You can submit a Confluence Questions and you will get an error below:
{quote}Invalid request
 Check your content and try resubmitting
{quote}
But you can't view the submitted Confluence Questions and also old Confluence questions that were submitted before
h3. Environment

Confluence 1000.0.0-d2f3f7bc191
Confluence Question: Version: 1.0.10-AC
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access *Questions* in the sidebar
 # Start typing your question and click *Save*
 # Try to view the *Question* you just submitted

h3. Expected Results
 * The user should not encounter any error when typing a Question. The question should be viewable after submitting it.

h3. Actual Results
 * Getting an error when typing a Question and it's not visible after submitting it.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Anchor link leading to another space don't work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a header in a page in space AAA.
# Open the editor in a page in space BBB
# Create a link leading to the header above: AAA:page#header
(following the syntax described in [Insert Links and Anchors \- Link to an anchor on a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html#InsertLinksandAnchors-Linktoananchoronapage])
 !Add space in the Insert link window.png|thumbnail! 
# click Insert
# click the link text and click "Edit"

h3. Expected Results
AAA:page#header is shown in the "Link" box

h3. Actual Results
page#header is shown in the "Link" box
 !Space disappear in Edit link.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If you proceed and publish the page, it will be like the following:
* Anchor function will be broken. If you click the link, the header won't be included in the opened URL.
 !opened URL dont contain header.png|thumbnail! 
* However, when you hover on the link, header will be included in the status bar.
 !status menu shown when hovering the link.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Anchor link leading to another page in same/different space don't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Shortcuts that are created in the space sidebar are not kept after a space/site import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create shortcuts on your space(s).
# Export your space/site as XML.
# Import your XML export to a new Confluence Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
The space shortcuts are kept and updated to the correct new URL.

h3. Actual Results
The space shortcuts are removed upon import.
 
h3.Workaround
No automated process to work around this issue. The shortcuts must be recreated manually post-import.
fields.summary: Shortcuts are not kept after import (space or site)

h3.Workaround
You may be able to export the space if it is smaller. 
To reduce the size of the space you can empty its trash bin, deleted unneeded content or split the space into smaller spaces.
To split the space into smaller ones you can create a temporary space, move pages from the original space to the temp space and try to export the spaces.
When the export finishes you can import each of the split spaces and once the import is done you can move the pages back to the original space and delete the temp spaces.
fields.summary: Unable to export space with a lot of content

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attachments Fail to Upload through the Link Button

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# While editing a Confluence page, click the *Insert Link* button on the Editor menu 
# Select the *Files* tab
# Click browse and look for a file on your local system
# Wait for the upload to complete

h3. Expected Results

The file should be uploaded as expected.

h3. Actual Results

If the file uploading process takes more than 10 minutes to complete, it will display the following error message:

{quote}
* Could not upload the file to Confluence. The server may be unavailable.
{quote}

And the following entry will be logged at the browser's console log:

{code}
/wiki/pages/attachfile.action 
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 403 ()
{code}

h3. Workaround

Upload the file through the *Insert Files and Images* option.
fields.summary: Attachments Fail to Upload through the Link Button

fields.description:
When using the [Task Report Macro for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/task-report-macro-724765319.html], the user can use the parameter *Space(s) and page(s)* in order to specify a page or a space with a specific title.

When the user has multiple pages with the same title, and the same looks to specify a page from a different space (or the current one, since the macro does not order the titles on the current space first), the same might not be displayed due to the limits from the results on the search. 

This is a suggestion to allow the search syntax to be used in order to retrieve specific pages on the search itself. For example, "from space:x, page title:y" and then, the search would bring pages titled "y" inside a space called "x".
fields.summary: Ability to Specify Pages from Specific Spaces on Task Report Search

fields.description:
Hi, 

Could you enhance the excerpt macro to include a hyperlink to the page the excerpt is from? 

If one shows the panel around the excerpt for example, the page name is in the panel header. Would it be difficult to add an option to the macro so one could choose that the page name in the header is also a link to the page?
fields.summary: excerpt macro enhancement

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customers who have customized the Columns in their Jira Issue/Filter Table macros in Confluence have noticed that some columns based on Custom Fields cannot be sorted

h3. Environment
- Cloud tested with Chrome (Version 64.0.3282.167 (Official Build) (64-bit)) and Firefox (58.0.2)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Jira Issue Macro to a Confluence Page and Configure the Display Option as a Table including Custom Fields like the Cascading List, Select List (single choice) or Text Field (single line) types
# View the Page and attempt to sort by one of the Custom Field Columns

h3. Expected Results
When Viewing the Confluence Page, we can sort based on these Custom Fields

h3. Actual Results
Mousing over the Columns does not allow us to Click on the Column Headers for Some Custom Field Types:
From testing it seems like Select List (single choice) or Text Field (single line) Custom Fields are not sortable and show a regular mouse cursor:
!NoSort-SingleChoiceField.png|thumbnail! 
Whereas sortable columns are highlighted and can be clicked:
!SortStatus.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
User and Date Picker Custom Fields along with regular System Fields (Status, Priority, Summary, Description) appear to be sortable without issues
This appears to be intermittent as customers have reported being able to sort these Custom Fields; may work on an initial page load but not after a refresh

h3.Workaround
* Sort the Table through the JQL used on the Macro; this will not allow you to change the sort but at least put the order based on the Unsortable Custom Field
* Wait for ~24 hours and check the column again
fields.summary: Unable to Sort Jira Issues Macro Table on Some Custom Fields

fields.description: I can't see my old saved for later posts beyond a certain point 😞 It spins like it's trying to load the next page but then it gives up.
fields.summary: Saved for later post pagination seems broken

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Add a WebPanel app to your atlassian-connect.json with the "location" set to "atl.footer"
 # Add the context-parameter {{space.key}} to the URL of that webPanel
 # Add a customContent type with a uiSupport.listViewComponent set (so that a menu item on space-level gets added)
 # Install the atlassian-connect.json
 # Navigate the customContent page (the one referenced in listViewComponent), using the link in the space sidebar.

*What happens:*

The URL of the WebPanel app does not contain a spaceKey ({{space.key}} is replaced with an empty string).

*What should happen:*

The URL should contain the correct spaceKey. And if a dialog is opened from the webPanel, using AP.dialog.create(...), then the URL of that dialog app should also contain the spaceKey (if {{space.key}} was specified there).
fields.summary: Context-parameter {space.key} is empty in webPanels loaded on custom-content pages

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the page contains an [Anchor Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/anchors-139442.html] in a different page from the link pointing it, it will not work. The page will be accessed but it will not scroll to the anchor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Create a new link to the Anchor. Through the *Add Hyperlink* button on the editor, go to *Advanced* and add a link to the anchor you've just created (Page Name#anchorname)
 # Create a new Page
 # Create an anchor with the name of the link in this different page. (example: anchorname)

h3. Expected Results

The link should redirect to the Anchor
h3. Actual Results

It will redirect to the page but not scroll to the anchor position.

h3. Workaround
Open the link in a new tab. The new tab will correctly lead to the anchor.
fields.summary: Anchors Do Not Work on Different pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When handling a large number of labels, user needs to know all of the labels that are available in order to not create useless additional label that may already exist under a different name.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to be able to see the list of existing labels while applying the label to a page or at least improve the search feature as right now labels will only be displayed if you type the beginning of the name.

Exemple: If I have a label _my-label-is-beautiful_, typing _beautiful_ will not make the label _my-label-is-beautiful_ displayed in the dropdown list. I will have to type _my_ to have the label displayed in the list.

h3. Workaround 
Users can currently set an additional page and use the *Labels list* macro to display all of their labels (filtered by space or not) and use it as an index.
fields.summary: Apply labels from a pre-defined list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to apply a different text colour to multiple rows in a table, it is no longer possible to only select partial multiple rows.
See screenshot below:
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 12.54.30.png|thumbnail! 

Although you can see that multiple lines are selected, only the first one is text highlighted.

If you wish to apply a text colour to multiple rows, you have to select the entire rows:
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-16 at 12.55.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table with multiple rows and columns.
# Select multiple rows but partially (end your selection a few columns before the last one)
# Apply a new colour to your text.

h3. Expected Results
All selected cells will have the new text colour applied.

h3. Actual Results
Only the first row has its text colour changed.
 
h3.Workaround
You will need to manually select each row one by one.
fields.summary: It is no longer possible to apply style to multiple partial rows in a table
Comparing Huge Changes Between Page Versions Timeout

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The 'page properties report' macro lists only the first line of the table.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and insert the page properties macro;
# Inside the macro, create a table with 2 lines or more (example below)
 !properties.png|thumbnail! 
# Create another page and insert the page properties report macro;
# Configure the macro to show the properties from the first page.

h3. Expected Results
The page properties report macro will display all information (all lines from the table) from the first page:
 !report.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Only the first line is shown.
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Page properties report macro lists only first line of the table
Customer is not able to like a page from the Like button at the notification e-mail

fields.description:
Typing character sets into the editor which are used to symbolize emojis turns them into emojis. This is not always desired as certain character strings might trigger this behavior unintentionally (such as code). 

It would be helpful if there were an option to turn this feature on or off, either via the editor, or in the user profile.
fields.summary: Allow option to disable characters turning to emojis

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Come to a page
* Add a comment, save it -> comment is added and on the page.
* View another page
* Come back to the first page -> don't see the comment that I've just created
fields.summary: Can't see comment after creating and navigating away

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a group is created with a whitespace at the beginning or the end of its name, it won't be able to be added to a space's permissions.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group with a whitespace at the end of its name
# Try to add it to a space's permissions

h3. Expected Results
The group is added to the space's permissions.

h3. Actual Results
The group is not added and an error is shown:
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 21.17.00.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The group appears at the suggestion box when typing its name, it's possible to select it, but it's not added.

h3.Workaround
Create another group without the whitespace.
fields.summary: Unable to add group to space's permissions

fields.description:
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create new Space with admin account: *Sample Space 1*
 # Log out of admin account, log in as *User 1*
 # Select Sample Space 1 *Overview* Tab > Watch icon - *Watch all content in this space*
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 3.51.07 pm.png|thumbnail!
 # Log out of *User 1*, Log into admin user
 # Remove Space permissions from *User 1*
 # Log in as *User 1*, view watches Spaces: <EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewnotifications.action
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 3.50.32 pm.png|thumbnail!
 # Sample *Space 1* shows up in the *Space Watches* section
 # Select *Stop Watching*. Text turns to *Start Watching*
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 3.50.38 pm.png|thumbnail!
 # Refresh page and *Stop Watching* appears again
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 3.50.44 pm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * *Stop watching* should allow users to Stop watching Space, regardless of permissions
 * Ideally, once a user's permission have been removed from Space, the user account should stop watching Space and Page content

h3. Actual Results
 * Stop Watching > Start Watching > Page Refresh > Stop Watching appears again
 * No way to Stop watching Space that you longer have permissions to View

h3. Notes

Related tickets
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-32136
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-36503

h3. Workaround
 # Add View Permissions to the User in the desired Space
 # Have User remove Space Watches
 ** <EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewnotifications.action
 # Remove View Permissions from User once done
fields.summary: Unable to Stop Watching Space if user no longer has View Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding multiple labels to Blog Posts macro, if one of these labels doesn't exist, it will display the following error message instead of showing the search results as well.
{code}
'Error rendering macro 'blog-posts' : <label> is not an existing label'
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a page, add a Blog Posts macro;
# Add multiple labels to the macro, including one that doesn't exist;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* An error message is displayed to inform that one label doesn't exist along with the search results of the other labels.

h3. Actual Results
* Only an error message about the non-existent label is shown.

h3.Workaround
* Remove the label that doesn't exist to display the results of the search normally.
fields.summary: Blog Posts macro doesn't display search results of multiple label's search if one of the labels doesn't exist

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When creating a page in Confluence by using the shortcut 'C', sometimes the pop-up menu won't display any information.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, type 'C'  or Click '+' to create a page.

h3. Expected Results
* A menu pops-up to show the options to create a page.

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing is displayed in the menu.

h3.Workaround
* Close the pop-up menu and try to open it again by pressing the *+* button after refreshing the page.
fields.summary: Not able to create pages using 'C' & '+' shortcut

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the user does have a template that includes anchors and links to the same if the title of the page created using the template does have a special character, the anchor will not work. 

For example, in a page called "Tests & Characters", the link inside the anchor will be "Tests&Characters-anchor", including the "&" character, which is what breaks the linking.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page including anchors. Due to [this bug report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26897], the user will need to perform a workaround (create a page with the anchors and copy/paste into the template)
# Once the template has been created, the user needs to create a new page in Confluence using it.
# Insert a special character in its title (for example, the "&" one)
# Have the user clicking on the link

h3. Expected Results
The link should redirect the user to the anchor created with the template.
h3. Actual Results
No actions are happening. It only adds the mentioned characters in the URL. 

h3.Workaround
Manually edit the links inside the specifically created page, so it will be pointing to the anchor.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In a table, It's not possible to select cells from a column anymore.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table;
# Populate it with data;
# Try to select cells from a column;

h3. Expected Results
Cells will be selected;

h3. Actual Results
Cells won't be selected and it's not possible to edit them.
 
h3. Notes
Cells inside a single line are selected as expected.

h3.Workaround
There is a workaround to select content inside many cells :
* put cursor at the point where you want to start the selection
* press and hold shift key
* click mouse on the ending point
* then you can format the selected content
fields.summary: Unable to select cells on a column

The managing of the add-ons and the add-ons system users should be available only to the administrators group and users with global permissions.

Is it possible to create a macro that only pulls tasks that are assigned to yourself with only today's date? This would prevent tasks that have dates in the past being prioritized over today's tasks.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'viewfile' office macros are not able to find documents if the page has a ':' on its title.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
Office macros
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with the ':' character in the middle of its title;
 # Attach an office file (xlsx, pptx, docx) to that page;
 # Add an office macro (respective to the document extension).

h3. Expected Results

The macro will find the document;
h3. Actual Results

The macro won't find the file.
h3. Notes

If the page title didn't have the ':' character but it was renamed after the macro was added, the following error is shown when editing the macro:
 {color:#FF0000}Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : The viewfile macro is unable to locate the page " <page title after the : char>" in space "<page title until the : char>"{color}
h3. Workaround

Remove the ':' character from the page.

Create multiple issues from table will cut description text in Spanish

fields.description:
h3.The Suggestion
This suggestion was open so administrators are able to remove one of the Activity Stream gadgets in Confluence Cloud. 

h3.The Reason
Whenever you are to insert a new Activity Stream gadget in a Confluence page, there are two options to choose from. Although one of those versions is affected by a strange behavior where sometimes it requires users to "Login and Approve" in order to view its contents, and after the user login and approves the gadget, the button never goes away. Basically, the difference between both Activity Streams is the URL that it is called upon.

The screenshot below describes the situation better:
 !Screen Shot 2018-02-13 at 14.22.37.png|thumbnail! 

As you can see above, there are two gadgets for the same functionality, but only one of them works without any issues. If perhaps one of them is meant to be used in Jira, then it would be better to leave it to be displayed only in Jira, and not in Confluence as well, since it is very confusing for end-users, and can lead to the disruption of their work.
fields.summary: Remove the malfunctioning Activity Stream Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User is unable to view Team Calendar if he has edit permission but view restriction is applied to any other user.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud;
* Team Calendars.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar;
# Apply restrictions and allow "edit" to a user;
# Apply view restricted to another user .

h3. Expected Results
The first user would still be able to view the calendar.

h3. Actual Results
The first user is not able to view the calendar.

h3. Notes
On step 2, the first user is still able to view the calendar.

h3.Workaround
Add user also to the View restriction.
fields.summary: User with edit permission is not able to view calendar

In the page comments is not shown the date hour of the comment.

It is only shown information about the number of minutes or hours the comment was created (if recent) . If not the comment date only displays the month day and year  (not the hour)

 

 

!image-2018-02-13-15-15-21-880.png!

Some months ago when user hover the cursor over the comment date,  the day and *hour* of the comment was shown. But since one recent version of Confluence cloud is not possible.

Could you add the funcionality of display the comments create *hour* again?

 

Thanks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
PDF Export inserts a unexpected like-break between English words and words in a certain language such as Japanese.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to "Site Administration" > "PDF Export Language Support"
#  Upload a font file to your tenant 
** Sucu as "ipag00303" at https://ipafont.ipa.go.jp/old/ipafont/download.html#en
# Create a page with a content below:
{code:none}
Word with a space 祇園精舎の鐘の声、諸行無常の響きあり、沙羅双樹の花の色、盛者必衰の理をあらわす、おごれる人も久しからず、ただ春の世の夢のごとし、たけき者も遂には滅びぬ、偏に風の前の塵に同じ。
{code}
# Export to PDF
**  [^557057_d90de407-9bc4-4cd6-a4c4-16ba6ab2787b-32833539-130218-0255.pdf] 
# Confirm that a line-break is inserted between "Word with a space" and "祇園精舎の鐘の声、..."

h3. Expected Results
No line-break is inserted in PDF as follows:
{code:none}
Word with a space 祇園精舎の鐘の声、...
{code}

h3. Actual Results
A line-break is inserted in PDF as follows:
{code:none}
Word with a space
祇園精舎の鐘の声、...
{code}


h3. Notes
Known conditions:
- This happens only if the text following to English words is long enough; specially, the text reaches the end of the side in a page.
- This happens only if there is a space between English words and an affected words.

These CSS styles don't mitigate the behavior
- word-break
- word-wrap

Verified language:
- (/) Chinese
- (x) Japanese 

h3.Workaround
- Avoid putting a space between English words and the other words in affected languages
fields.summary: PDF Export inserts an unexpected line-break between words in 2 different languages

fields.description:
As a Confluence/Stride user I want stride to recognise when I'm asking a question in a room.

Inspiration for this feature request: [https://abe-winter.github.io/plea's/help/2018/02/11/slack.html]

Server ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54968

Pls coordinate to present the same external api (as much as possible)
fields.summary: Stride - smart detecting questions, and searching / creating a confluence question

When viewing pages with JIRA issue macros, Some or all JIRA issue macros on the page will fail to load and will instead give a "Getting Issues..." error instead.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

All macros load every time.
h3. Actual Results

Intermittently, The macros will fail to load and you will instead see an error like this:

=== "Getting Issues..." Error ===

2018-02-09 21:20:20.434	ERROR	com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper	Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null	 	java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.JiraFilterService.setupResponse(JiraFilterService.java:109) at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.jira.JiraFilterService.getRenderedJiraMacros(JiraFilterService.java:91) {code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you are pasting images directly from an image editing program from the clipboard into Confluence questions, you will see that the image is pasted into the question/answer as an attached image. If you do this with multiple images, then all images will be displayed as the last image that was pasted in.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a question in confluence questsions.
- Answer the question and paste a couple of distinct images from the clipboard. You can do this by opening an image in any image editing program, then selecting and copy the whole image. Then directly paste the image from the clipboard into the answer. It will upload as an attachment.
- Repeat the above step at least a couple to times to get at least two images, the preview should show the distinct pasted images correctly.
- Post the answer.


h3. Expected Results
The images show up as separate and distinct images, as indicated by the preview before save.

h3. Actual Results
You will end up with all images that were added this way being displayed as the last image that was pasted this way.

h3. Notes
This does not happen if you upload the image as an actual file.
All pasted images have the same default filename *image.png*

h3.Workaround
At this time, the only workaround is to save the image and upload it as a file.
fields.summary: Pasting images direct from clipboard into Confluence Questions will overwrite all pasted images with last image pasted.

fields.description:
It would be powerful to have the content of my Trello boards searchable from Confluence Cloud. At the moment there is no Kanban style functionality in Confluence, and by opening this link between Trello and Confluence, the entire Trello ecosphere becomes part of Confluence.

 

Then Trello can be embedded and used for task management, with comments and attachments searchable from Confluence (no context switching). 

 

One possible implementation of this could consist of a "Trello" Space in Confluence, with a linked Trello board. An automatically created sub-space for every Trello list, and an automatically created Page for every Trello card. Any content added to the card is automatically "synced" to the Page, and the Page is moved to the relevant Sub-space when the card is moved around to different lists. Ie - Trello becomes a visual into Confluence. (Similar to how Zenhub built a Kanban interface on top of GitHub Issues)
fields.summary: Tight integration of Trello and Confluence

This is an essential daily feature.

Working with tables without that is cray.

y u no have the same feature for Confluence Cloud

(https://twitter.com/AskAtlassian/status/962089954217111552)
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for cut / copy / paste table row in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Software Project Spaces are created with random languages

h3. Description

When creating a *Software Project Space*, the page blueprints (*Decision Log*, *File lists*, *Meeting notes*, *Product requirements*, *Retrospectives*) are created on a different language - such as *Spanish*, *Portuguese*, *French* and *Russian*.

This isn't reproducible all the time, but it has been observed on multiple instances with different settings that don't feature any of these languages as the default for the instance, indexing or the user who triggered the space creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# In an instance with *JIRA Software* and *Confluence*, create a *Software Project Space* linking to a JIRA project.
# Check the newly created Space's pages

h3. Expected Results

They should display in the user's configured language.

h3. Actual Results

They are created with a language different from the one's configured at the instance's settings / user's profile.

h3. Workaround

Manually changing the page's names.

||English||Portuguese||Spanish||French||Russian||Japanese||Korean|
|Decision Log|Registro de decisão|Registro de decisiones|Journal de décision|Журнал решений|決定に関するログ|결정사항 관련 로그|
|File lists|Listas de arquivo|Listas de archivos|Listes de dossier|Списки файлов|ファイルリスト|파일 목록|
|Meeting notes|Notas de reuniões|Minuta|Notes de réunion|Записи совещания|会議メモ|회의 노트|
|Product requirements|Requisitos do produto|Requisitos del producto|Exigences du produit|Требования к продукту|製品要件|제품 요구사항|
|Restrospectives|Retrospectivas|Retrospectivas|Rétrospectives|Ретроспективы|振り返り|회고록|
fields.summary: Software Project Spaces are created with random languages

fields.description:
h3.The Issue
When creating an Inline Comment in a Confluence page and mentioning any user, once the comment is published, the mention disappears.

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any page with content
# Highlight some text and click on the *Inline Comment* icon
# @Mention someone and write some more text to the comment
# Publish it

h3.Expected results
The mention would appear together with the content

h3.Actual results
The mention disappear and only the rest of the text is displayed

h3.Workaround
After publishing the comment, click on *Edit* and save the comment once again
fields.summary: "@" Mentions not working on Inline Comments

fields.description:
I'm a big fan of Confluence and the new design is starting to resonate with me.

My biggest suggestion is to improve the collaboration piece for editing docs. We used to use Google Docs and that made it a lot easier to leave/respond/act on comments than we can on Confluence. I realize it may be harder to do versioning but I think there's more you can do here.

Some ideas on how to improve the editing/collaboration experience:
- When loading a page with comments automatically expand them (similar to Google Docs)
- Somehow see the comments when editing a page so you can address them in the same tab
- Ways of doing quick/minor edits inline without going through the full edit flow - maybe this can be non versioned and non notified as well.

I'm sure I can think of more ideas and would be glad to share them!
fields.summary: Improved collaboration functionality

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
This request came from the users (roughly 1100 people) in the company.
They don't delete users from Atlassian cloud if their work history exist when they left the company, instead, they deactivate them. Users know the fact that inactive people in Jira left the company. But they cannot know of it in Confluence. This is a very important point in the collaboration tools.

h5. Suggested solution
Display a "(inactive)" text alongside with the deactivated user's name, as it's on Jira.
fields.summary: Display "inactive" text next to deactivated user's name

fields.description:
Hello... I am using Confluence version 5.9.5, and was wondering if there is an upgraded version currently in development which will include additional bullet list options? The only way I have found to add open disc/circle bullets to indented bullet lists is to add the Fancy Bullets macro, which is completely inefficient and time consuming. Hitting tab also just keeps the bullets as a closed disc. A drop down in the Bullet List icon which includes closed disc, open disc, square, etc. options (as found in MS Word) seems like an obvious function to add into Confluence editor. I understand that hitting dash and tab adds a square bullet, but there is no simple way to add an open disc bullet.  I've searched online but have found no solutions that don't include macros or coding.  Please advise.  

Thank you for your attention.
fields.summary: Bullet list options

fields.description:
As a space admin, I would like to place view only restrictions on a page, but still allow users (who are not in the admin group) to mark tasks/actions contained on that page and assigned to them as complete so that I can ensure approved minutes cannot be changed while still allowing users to close out actions which were assigned in the meeting.

 

Specific example would be meeting minutes. Once the minutes are agreed, I would like to lock them so that they can no longer be edited, but currently doing this prevents all users from marking any actions/tasks on this meeting minutes page from being marked as completed. If this were changed so that when the view only restriction were applied a user who was assigned a task still had the ability to mark it as complete it would be much better.

Related to CONFCLOUD-40985

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently label function is not supported in the Confluence mobile app.
Users can't see existing labels and they can't add or change them, too.

h3. Suggested Solution

Use the browser from the mobile phone

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently label function is not supported in the Confluence mobile app.
Users can't see existing labels and they can't add or change them, too.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to view/add/edit labels from mobile app.

h3. Why this is important
Labels are used frequently in the browser version. The miss of this feature is preventing users to use Confluence from the mobile apps.

h3. Workaround 
Use the browser from the mobile phone
fields.summary: Support label function in mobile app(Android)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently user mentions are not one of the supported macros when creating/editing a page in the Confluence Cloud Mobile App. 

When typing '@' there is no pop-up to select a mentionable user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to mention users from the mobile app.

h3. Why this is important
There are many missing features so far and I believe this will be one of the most-requested.
 
h3. Workaround 
No known workaround for mobile
fields.summary: Support user mentions in mobile app(Android)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
The numbers of task being displayed on exported PDF or Words pages will only display the first page of "Task Report" when number of tasks per page are being limited.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add "Task Report" and limit the Number of tasks per page and save
# Export to PDF or Words

h3. Expected Result
* The content on the PDF or Words display all the Tasks from the report

h3. Actual Result
* Only the first Task Report page is being displayed

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Export to PDF or Words don't display all pages

fields.description:
* Use a setup with IE11 (when we reproduced it we used Windows 8.1 but that is most likely not necessary)
 * Install RefinedSpaces and activate the Refined theme
 * Go to the overview of a space (or a page or similar in that space

Supporting ticket: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-956
fields.summary: In IE 11, Error in confluence navigation: Object.keys: argument is not an Object when theme is activated

fields.description:
h3.The issue
Firefox is not rendering Roadmap Planner macro text

h3.Steps to Reproduce
Just insert a Roadmap Planner macro on a page, it also happens if you use the *Include Pages* Macro and display a page with a roadmap planner macro. 

h3.Workaround
For now, the only workaround is to use Google Chrome, as displayed on the macro itself where it states:
{quote}
h5. (!) Firefox Issues

Confluence's Roadmap Planner widget does not display properly within Firefox.  As of 06 Feb 2018, this issue has been reported but not resolved.  Your workaround is to view this page using Google Chrome.
{quote}
fields.summary: Firefox not rendering Roadmap Planner Macro text

fields.description:
Navigating to a themed space in IE11 shows the following error:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Themed spaces are broken in IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a document with comments, if you scroll manually and select the next comment any zoom functionality that you have set is reset back and you then need to zoom back in again on each occurrence.


h3. Suggestion
Do not reset the zoom when selecting the next comment on the document.
fields.summary: Don't reset document zoom when selecting next comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is no way of scrolling through comments in the order that they appear on attachments. They seem to be sequenced (numbered) in the order that they were entered. 

Using the comment arrow navigation arrows will navigate you by comment sequence number. This does not help if you are trying to peer review walking through the document with the team online.

h3. Suggestion
Suggest that comment scroll arrows navigate to next comment in document placement order, not by creation time.
fields.summary: Allow attachment comments to be sorted according to order on document

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a page is shared, the notification e-mail sent to the user will display its group instead of its username.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any page;
# Share it with anybody.

h3. Expected Results
The person will receive an e-mail reporting that a page was shared with its group.

h3. Actual Results
The person should receive an e-mail reporting that a page was shared with its username.
 
h3. Notes
This is a aesthetic issue, not impacting the system usage.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: E-mail notification shows user group instead of user name when sharing page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Single Column Page Layout has been applied to a page, exporting the page to PDF cuts off the left-hand side of the page.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Confluence page.
# Select *Page Layout* and *Single Column Layout*:
!Screen Shot 2018-04-25 at 10.39.10 AM.png|thumbnail! 
# Add your text into the layout cell.
# Publish the page.
# Click *. . . > Export to PDF*

h3. Expected Results
* The PDF file generated is normal and all text is legible. 

h3. Actual Results
* The PDF file generated is truncated on the left.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-25 at 10.40.42 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Use another page layout instead, such as *Full Width*, or two or 3 columns.
* Another option is to instead insert a single table cell, center this on the page, and set to *Fixed Width* rather than *Responsive*. This will have a similar appearance. The downside of this is if there is already a table that should go into this layout, it won't work since nested tables are currently unsupported in Cloud: CONFCLOUD-58656
fields.summary: Single column page layout truncates left side of PDF export

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user with blank space in the username creates a personal space, the pages will fail intermittently to load and give a 404 Error - "Oops you've found a dead link".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create user with a username contains a blank space
# After that, create a personal space
# Create some pages in the space
# Leave the space and re-access the personal space
# Access the pages

h3. Expected Results
* Pages will load as expected.


h3. Actual Results
* Pages will fail to load intermittently and give a 404 Error - "Oops you've found a dead link".

h3.Workaround
* Return to the previous page using the *back arrow* in the browser;
* Access the page again;
* Repeat the process until the page displays.
fields.summary: Blank space in username breaks pages in Personal Spaces intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Backup is failing for large instances

h3. Description
The backup task is getting stuck for several days at *Archiving Attachments* in large Confluence Cloud sites.

h3. Workaround
Export the spaces individually to XML.
fields.summary: Backup is failing for large instances

fields.description:
Could you please consider adding two more options to the dropdown-options of team-calenders.

We have ppl organizing a lot of calenders which by now makes them lose the overview. What they have to do now is to hide-out (click) all the calenders/types they dont want see at the moment which takes a lot of time with a decent ammount of calenders.

Solution would be to add two options to the options-dropdown of each calendar:
show/hide all other calenders (see image attached)
fields.summary: Hide/Show all other calendars option for Confluence Team Calendars
